items.title: Microsoft is replacing Remote Desktop with its new Windows app
Brompton G e-bike review: truth in advertising
The best instant cameras you can buy right now
Steam Deck, ROG Ally, and more: all the news about the handheld PC gaming revolution
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Today marks the third anniversary of Steam Deck, which has significantly impacted the handheld PC gaming market.
- Despite a rocky start, Valve’s device has outsold all its competitors combined according to IDC estimates.
- New products like the Asus ROG Ally X and Lenovo Legion Go are emerging, with various reviews highlighting their features and performance.
- The Steam Deck Folio Kickstarter campaign aims to provide a protective case that doubles as a stand.
- The ROG Ally battery upgrade kit offers an increase of 62.5% more battery life.

items.title: The best iPhones
Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt is the newest Big Tech-to-space exec
This is just the start
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- Mahmoud Khalil, a former Columbia University student, was arrested by ICE on March 8 for involvement in pro-Palestine protests despite having a green card.
- ICE claimed they were enacting orders from the State Department to revoke his student visa; however, Khalil is a permanent resident which complicates this.
- Khalil's attorney described the arrest as retaliation against political speech, highlighting government repression of students criticizing Israel's actions in Gaza.
- The Department of Homeland Security labeled Khalil's activities as aligned with Hamas, suggesting a targeting of protests against Israel under the guise of national security.
- Concerns were raised about ICE's surveillance capabilities and the chilling effect of such arrests on free speech and activism on campus.

items.title: The best Mario Day deals on Nintendo Switch games and accessories
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary: - Many retailers are offering steep discounts for Mario titles and accessories to celebrate Mario Day. - The sale includes new Nintendo Switch bundles and iconic Mario games available at their lowest prices to date. - Discounts from various retailers will continue through March 16, 2025, with many deals featured on platforms like Amazon and Walmart. - Key game titles like Super Mario Bros. Wonder and Super Mario RPG are highlighted with significant savings. - Also included in the deals are Mario-themed Legos and accessories, marking a festive shopping opportunity for fans.

items.title: Bluesky gets three-minute videos and a filter to help with DM spam
The entire story of Twitter / X under Elon Musk
Nintendo's Alarmo uses the tech that could solve Joy-Con stick drift
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nintendo continues to use older Joy-Con hardware potentially causing joystick drift issues.
- iFixit reveals Hall effect sensors in the new Alarmo alarm clock during a teardown.
- Alarmo features a 2.4-inch LCD screen, 24GHz mmWave presence sensor, and a replaceable CR2032 battery for backup.
- The inclusion of a magnet and Hall effect sensor is aimed at improving the durability and accuracy of its rotary dial.

items.title: How the EU’s DMA is changing Big Tech: all of the news and updates
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA) enforces stricter regulations on Big Tech, affecting companies like Apple and Google.
- Apple plans to introduce sideloading and alternative app stores on the iPhone to comply with EU regulations.
- Meta and Apple may soon face modest fines due to alleged violations; Google also rumored to face charges.
- The EU aims for enhanced competition by implementing interoperability measures for major tech companies.

items.title: Apple is reportedly planning a design overhaul for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple plans a significant redesign for iOS 19, iPadOS 19, and macOS 16 later this year.
- Changes will include updates to icons, menus, apps, windows, and system buttons to simplify user experience.
- The design takes inspiration from Vision Pro’s visionOS, marking the biggest changes since macOS Big Sur and iOS 7.
- Expected announcement at June's Worldwide Developers Conference, date not yet announced.

items.title: An iconic DJ turntable inspired this record player watch
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The AndoAndoAndo Vinyl Record Automatic Watch resembles a tiny turntable, inspired by the Technics SL-1200.
- It features a Miyota 9039 mechanical movement with a 42-hour power reserve.
- The watch face has a unique design without number labels, using dots to indicate time.
- The minute hand mimics a turntable's tone arm, and the watch includes a miniature vinyl record with two discs for timekeeping.
- Preorders are available for $438 for standard versions and $455 for a limited all-gold edition, with shipping expected in April 2025.

items.title: Sony is experimenting with AI-powered PlayStation characters
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Sony is developing an AI-powered prototype of Aloy from *Horizon Forbidden West*.
- The demo shows Aloy interacting via voice prompts using AI for speech and facial movements.
- The technology employs OpenAI’s whisper, GPT-4, and Llama 3 for conversation.
- Sony has run demo tests on PC and PS5 with minimal overhead.
- Concerns identified about the impact of such technology on voice actors and game developers.
- Similar AI initiatives by Nvidia and Microsoft are mentioned, highlighting industry trends in AI application.
- A GDC 2024 survey indicates a significant interest in generative AI tools among game developers.

items.title: Microsoft is holding a 50th anniversary and Copilot event in April
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is inviting attendees to its 50th anniversary and Copilot event in Redmond, Washington on April 4, 2025.
- The event coincides with the company's founding in 1975 by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.
- It will feature an employee celebration and discussions on future developments for the Copilot AI.
- Notable speakers include CEO Satya Nadella and AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman.
- The event may showcase Microsoft’s in-house AI models aimed at competing with OpenAI.

items.title: Google's New AI Button in Gmail Automatically Adds Events to Google Calendar
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Google introduces a new AI feature in Gmail that uses Gemini AI to add events directly to Google Calendar based on email content.
- The feature includes an 'Add to Calendar' button for emails that describe events, streamlining the process of adding those events via a sidebar confirmation.
- This change is currently being rolled out for Workspace users, business, education, and Google One AI Premium subscribers, enhancing the functionality of previous non-AI event additions.

items.title: Longer-lasting laptops: the modular hardware you can upgrade and repair yourself
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The article discusses the growing trend of modular laptops that allow users to upgrade and repair their devices easily.
- Framework is highlighted as a leading company in this movement, producing laptops designed for longevity and upgradability.
- Other manufacturers, such as Lenovo, are beginning to adopt similar designs, driven by consumer demand for sustainable electronics.
- Past attempts by companies like Dell and Intel with modular products faced issues, paving the way for Framework's success.
- The focus is on making laptops more user-friendly regarding repairs and upgrades, contrasting with the ultrathin models that have dominated the market.

items.title: Trump’s Administration: Impact on the Tech Industry After 100 Days
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Adam Martinez from the CFPB addressed staff confusion regarding work regulations during a court hearing.
- The GSA's DOGE chatbot is expanding usage among federal workers following a 150-person pilot, with mixed feedback.
- The DOJ continues to advocate for breaking up Google, referencing its monopolistic practices.
- Trump imposed and then paused tariffs on uranium, affecting US nuclear fuel imports from Canada.
- Trump has established a 'strategic Bitcoin reserve' to hold seized cryptocurrency assets, aiming for a digital asset stockpile.
- Tariffs on Canadian and Mexican goods initiated by Trump are largely on hold, indicating a shift in policy.
- A new State Department program using AI to monitor student activists aims to revoke visas based on social media activity related to pro-Palestine protests.

items.title: Infinity Nikki's New Interactive Map Makes It Easier to Find What You Need
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- The developers of Infinity Nikki have introduced an interactive map to help players locate items in the game.
- The map is similar to features found in other gacha games like Genshin Impact.
- Players can find dews of inspiration and other collectibles more easily with the new system.
- The interactive map is accessible through [this site](https://pearpal.infoldgames.com/en/home) and requires logging in with Infinity Nikki account credentials for personalized features.
- It helps track missing items like treasure chests and hidden vendors in the game.

items.title: Sony will give the PS5 Pro crisper graphics — by backporting FSR 4
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Sony's PS5 Pro will leverage AMD's FSR 4 upscaling technology starting in 2026 to enhance game graphics.
- FSR 4 aims to improve image clarity, competing with Nvidia's DLSS.
- The collaboration between Sony and AMD, known as Project Amethyst, began in 2023, with FSR 4 being a key outcome.
- Current games on PS5 Pro are using another upscaling method known as PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution (PSSR).
- Sony intends to develop unique implementations of various algorithms with AMD beyond gaming consoles, aiming for broader applications in machine learning.

items.title: All the news about Sony’s PS5 Pro
The Tesla protests are getting bigger — and rowdier
Fortnite is set to return to Brazilian iPhones
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Epic Games plans to bring Fortnite to iOS users in Brazil in July 2024.
- This follows a Brazilian ruling requiring Apple to allow sideloading within 90 days.
- In August 2023, Epic launched the mobile Epic Games Store on iOS in the EU after Apple was forced to comply with the Digital Markets Act.
- The Brazilian judge noted that Apple has complied with similar obligations in other countries without significant harm to its economic model, and Apple intends to appeal this ruling.
- The Epic Games Store is already available on Android and was launched on iPad in the EU in September 2024.

items.title: Why the internet still needs Section 230
items.author: Ron Wyden
items.summary:
- Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act is often blamed for internet issues, but it remains crucial today.
- Trump and other politicians challenge Section 230, claiming it allows tech companies too much control.
- The law provides a liability shield for tech platforms, essential for their existence, especially for new competitors like Bluesky.
- Section 230 allows individuals to control what they see online without intrusive government regulation.
- The law emphasizes that distributors (like websites) are not liable for user-generated content.
- In 1996, Wyden and Chris Cox crafted Section 230 amidst government censorship fears and rising internet use.
- The law was passed after a critic's failed bid to impose strict regulations on internet content.
- It provides essential protections to both content creators and distributors, enabling free expression online.

items.title: Space collisions could become a bigger risk thanks to greenhouse gas pollution
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Greenhouse gas emissions could increase satellite collision risks by contracting Earth's upper atmosphere.
- The study published in *Nature Sustainability* explores the implications of pollution on satellite operations.
- Research estimates that satellite carrying capacity could decline by 50 to 66 percent in 75 years under high emissions scenarios.
- Current satellite numbers exceed 20,650; growing concerns over collisions as more satellites crowd lower Earth orbit.
- The findings underscore the need for space sustainability awareness among satellite operators and the public.

items.title: My Hero Academia: Vigilantes slides onto Crunchyroll in April
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Crunchyroll will stream *My Hero Academia: Vigilantes* starting April 7th, with new episodes weekly.
- The series is a prequel to *My Hero Academia*, set five years earlier.
- The story revolves around Koichi Haimawari, a college student with a quirk that allows him to glide, as he helps people alongside his friends.

items.title: OnePlus’ signature Alert Slider is ‘evolving’ into a button
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- OnePlus will replace the Alert Slider with a customizable button, as announced by CEO Pete Lau.
- The change aims to provide a more personalized experience and will retain the ability to switch sound profiles without waking the phone.
- No details on which models will receive the new button or its release date have been provided.

items.title: X is having an up and down Monday
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The X social media platform experienced repeated outages affecting posts across mobile and desktop since around 5:40 AM ET.
- Users reported issues with timelines not refreshing and receiving an error message on the web version of X.
- Outages appear to be global, with brief downtime lasting several minutes at a time, while competitors like Bluesky and Threads remain accessible.

items.title: All the smart home news, reviews, and gadgets you need to know about
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The smart home offers convenience, safety, and energy efficiency with various gadgets like smart lights, locks, and robot vacuums.
- Keeping track of the latest smart home technology can be challenging due to frequently released products and features.
- Regular updates on product reviews, guides, and the latest innovations from major tech companies are available.
- Abode has launched a new app for controlling its security system from Apple TV, allowing for arming/disarming and live video view.
- Ikea has registered a Matter-over-Thread temperature and humidity sensor with the FCC, named “Timmerflotte.”
- Amazon announced Alexa Plus, a generative AI integration aimed at improving user interaction without the need for specific commands.

items.title: The Best Robot Vacuums
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Robot vacuums have evolved into advanced cleaning devices, capable of vacuuming and mopping with minimal user intervention.
- The article presents various categories including best overall, budget, mopping robots, and hybrids for specific needs such as pet hair management.
- Top pick: Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra, priced at approximately $1,799.99, with excellent AI-powered obstacle detection and high suction power for effective cleaning.
- Best budget option: Tapo RV30 Max Plus for around $250, featuring auto-empty dock and smart navigation with some limitations in battery life and obstacle detection.

items.title: JBL’s new Flip 7 and Charge 6 speakers boost battery life and sound quality
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- JBL announces the new JBL Flip 7 and Charge 6 Bluetooth speakers.
- Flip 7 includes a rugged design, upgraded tweeter, and 14 hours of playtime (up to 16 with Playtime Boost).
- Charge 6 features an upgraded woofer, four more hours of battery (totaling 24 hours, or up to 28 with Playtime Boost).
- Both speakers incorporate JBL’s AI Sound Boost technology to improve volume without distortion.
- Flip 7 available for preorder at $149.95; Charge 6 priced at $199.95, both shipping April 4.
- Both models have improved waterproof ratings (IP68) and multi-speaker connectivity via Bluetooth Auracast.

items.title: Dow Jones CEO Almar Latour on AI, press freedom, and the future of news
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Almar Latour is the CEO of Dow Jones and publisher of The Wall Street Journal.
- He discussed the challenges facing the news industry, including competition from free content and issues related to AI and copyright.
- Latour has made a significant content-use deal with OpenAI and is developing AI data products for Dow Jones.
- He is an advocate for press freedom, notably fighting for the release of WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich from Russia.
- The Wall Street Journal recently laid off tech reporters as part of a restructuring effort in its newsroom.
- Latour emphasized the importance of distinctive journalism and investing in quality reporting over austerity measures.

items.title: Lego’s new Mario Kart set super-sizes Mario
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The new Lego Mario Kart set contains 1,972 pieces and is available for preorder at $169.99.
- It will ship on May 15th, 2025.
- The set features Mario in his standard racing kart, measuring 12.5 inches long and 8.5 inches tall.
- Includes the largest buildable version of Mario with a detailed face and posable features.
- Comes with a display stand to show the kart in a dynamic angle.
- Announced as part of Nintendo's promotions for MAR10 Day on March 10, 2025.

items.title: Six thoughts on Apple’s new M3 iPad Air
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Apple launched the new iPad Air with M3 chip, priced at $599 (11-inch) and $799 (13-inch).
- Performance increase is about 12-15% compared to the M2 chip.
- The new Magic Keyboard includes function keys and passthrough charging, costing $269.
- No Face ID, only Touch ID available, which is seen as less convenient.
- 11-inch model is more portable compared to the 13-inch model.
- Apple Intelligence features are present but not pivotal for device choice currently.

items.title: Death Stranding 2 is coming on June 26th
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- **Release Date**: June 26th for *Death Stranding 2: On the Beach*.
- **Pre-order Start**: March 17th, with a standard price of $69.99.
- **Special Editions**: Digital Deluxe Edition ($79.99) and Collector’s Edition ($229.99) offer early access on June 24th.
- **Trailer Highlights**: Features main characters including Sam (Norman Reedus) and Neil (Luca Marinelli) in a 10-minute trailer presented by Hideo Kojima.
- **Character Cameos**: Includes appearances from Fragile, Tarman, Higgs, and Elle Fanning's character, among others.
- **Unique Feature**: Neil wears a bandana reminiscent of Solid Snake from *Metal Gear Solid*.
- **Concert Tour**: “The Strands of Harmony World Tour” begins November 8th, 2025, featuring live orchestral music from the game.

items.title: Some Chromecasts are giving ‘Untrusted device’ errors today
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Users report that second-generation Chromecasts and Chromecast Audios are displaying ‘outdated’ firmware warnings.
- Error message reads: “Untrusted device,” indicating potential loss of support for these devices.
- Google has not officially stated it is discontinuing support, but users express concern over the issue.
- Google’s support is aware and is reportedly working on a fix for the problem.
- Chromecast line was discontinued in August 2024, though Google promised continued updates for newer devices.

items.title: Here’s what the newest iPhone Air leaks say about its design
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple is expected to release the iPhone 17 Air, which may be its thinnest phone yet at approximately 5.5mm thick.
- Recent rumors suggest a screen size of 6.9 inches, similar to the iPhone 17 Pro Max, with dimensions comparable to the iPhone 16 Pro Max.
- Design features include a rear camera bar, a USB-C port, speaker holes, Dynamic Island, and Face ID, with official details expected in September 2025.

items.title: Forza Horizon 5 will require a Microsoft account on PS5
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The PS5 version of Forza Horizon 5 requires linking a Microsoft account to PlayStation Network the first time you play.
- If you unlink the account later, you can only relink to the original Microsoft account.
- The game lacks cross-platform saving, meaning progress won’t transfer between PS5 and Xbox.
- Players will need a PlayStation Plus subscription for multiplayer access, with no plans for a disc release.
- The game is set to release on April 29th, continuing the trend of Xbox exclusives appearing on PS5.

items.title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- AI technologies are evolving, with Google and OpenAI competing to rewire the internet.
- Recent changes include the naming of Google’s AI as Gemini and the introduction of Gemini Apps powered by Gemini Flash 2.0.
- OpenAI releases GPT-4o, a faster, free model for ChatGPT users.
- Concerns about AI hallucinations and ethical issues like copyright lawsuits are highlighted.
- AI chatbots are compared with notable developments in Microsoft’s Copilot Pro and Meta's generative AI implications.

items.title: Apple’s plans for a smart display suffer a Siri-related setback
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple has delayed its Siri AI upgrade, impacting the launch of its rumored smart display.
- The smart display is expected to be a home hub with a display, similar to Amazon and Google offerings, supporting Apple Intelligence and running on tvOS.
- The release of the upgraded Siri is now delayed until the “coming year,” which may mean it won’t be included in iOS 18 as originally planned.

items.title: Some nice upgrades for Apple’s best gadgets
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The new MacBook Air features improved performance, a better webcam, and a lower price point.
- The new base model iPad is recommended as the best all-around option, priced at $349.
- Upcoming highlights include new releases such as "Daredevil: Born Again" and the game "Split Fiction." 
- Unique features of the Nothing Phone 3A include an Essential Space for organizing media.
- The article discusses various community recommendations and personal tech habits.

items.title: Retroid offered very limited returns for its unfixable handheld
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The Retroid Pocket Mini has an unfixable screen issue affecting graphical effects for emulated games.
- Return window is limited to March 8th to March 14th and capped at 200 returns for customers outside China.
- Acknowledged problems include misplaced scanlines and distorted images, which cannot be fixed.
- Customers are required to pay for shipping returns, but Retroid promises reimbursement.
- Retroid is also offering a $10 coupon for future handheld purchases to all Pocket Mini owners.

items.title: The Last of Us season 2 gets an explosive new trailer
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery released a new trailer for *The Last of Us* season 2, highlighting the dangerous world protagonists Joel and Ellie face.
- The trailer features a snowy human settlement under attack by a zombie horde, showcasing numerous explosions and intense action scenes.
- Season two stars Jeffrey Wright as Isaac Dixon, Isabela Merced as Dina, and Kaitlyn Dever as Abby, and is set to premiere on April 13th on Max.

items.title: Trump’s DOJ still says Google should be broken up
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The US DOJ is still advocating for the breakup of Google, insisting it must sell Google Chrome and potentially Android due to its monopolistic practices.
- The DOJ describes Google as an "economic goliath" that restricts consumer choice.
- The department has proposed that Google divest its Chrome browser and alter its Android operations to foster competition.
- The DOJ has relaxed some demands, now allowing Google to pay Apple for unrelated services and does not call for divestment of its AI investments, but requires notification for future AI investments.
- Google submitted its counterproposal, which does not involve selling Chrome but suggests restrictions on its business practices, such as licensing conditions.

items.title: Check your DVDs for disc rot — Warner Bros. says it’s replacing them
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Home Entertainment acknowledged disc rot issues in DVDs produced from 2006 to 2008.
- Affected consumers can replace defective discs with the same title or a similar value title if the original is out of print.
- Disc rot can lead to unplayable DVDs, a problem that has been discussed extensively in forums like DVD Talk and Home Theater Forum.
- A YouTuber provided insights suggesting broader issues with discs from 2006 to 2009, and shared a list of known affected titles including popular series and films.
- Users can check for playback problems such as discs that won't load or freeze during playback.

items.title: The Apple Watch Series 10 just received its first $100 discount
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
• The Apple Watch Series 10 is currently discounted by $100, now available for $299 at retailers like Amazon, Walmart, and Best Buy.
• The watch features a larger OLED display, faster charging, and improved sleep apnea detection.
• The Series 10 can charge from 0 to 80% in just 30 minutes and offers fitness features integrated with watchOS 11.

items.title: It’s a great moment for classic RPGs
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The author reflects on playing classic RPGs, particularly focusing on the remastered collection of Suikoden, and its intricate storytelling.
- Notable recent releases include remastered versions of Dragon Quest 3 and Fantasian, both enhancing the RPG experience with updated visuals and gameplay improvements.
- Despite the presence of modern RPGs, the classic turn-based formula remains unique and continues to evolve, with more projects on the horizon from developers like Hironobu Sakaguchi.

items.title: The best entertainment of 2025
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- A curated list of favorite games, TV shows, and movies from 2025.
- Recommendations include options for streaming, theaters, and various gaming devices.
- The list will be updated throughout the year with new favorites.

items.title: MainFrames is a charming platformer that takes place inside computers
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- MainFrames is an indie platformer where players control a floppy disk navigating computer desktops.
- Features charming characters, pixelated backgrounds, and a catchy chiptune soundtrack.
- Players can manipulate computer windows to solve puzzles and progress through levels.
- The game offers a variety of platforming challenges and accessibility features for easier play.
- Comparable to the game Celeste, it provides a quick respawn after failures, keeping gameplay engaging.
- MainFrames takes about four hours to complete and is available on Nintendo Switch and PC.
